docs.snippet: The Detroit Lions added the four-time All-Pro kicker David Akers, one day after their veteran Jason Hanson retired....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Detroit Lions added the four-time All-Pro kicker David Akers, one day after their veteran Jason Hanson retired.
docs.abstract: Detroit Lions acquire kicker David Akers.

headline.seo: Lions Add Veteran Kicker David Akers

docs.snippet: It’s easy to say Bear Bryant’s tactics in 1954 would be universally unaccepted today. Then we see how the Rutgers coach firing played out....
docs.lead_paragraph: It’s easy to say Bear Bryant’s tactics in 1954 would be universally unaccepted today. Then we see how the Rutgers coach firing played out.
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports Of The Times column recalls ruthless training methods espoused by 1950s college football coach Bear Bryant; holds that scandal surrounding Rutgers basketball coach Mike Rice is strong reminder that such brutality has survived to current era.

headline.seo: The Line From the Junction Boys to Rutgers — William C. Rhoden
headline.main: A Motivational Thread Ties the Junction Boys to Rutgers
headline.print_headline: A Motivational Thread Ties the Junction Boys to Rutgers

docs.snippet: A Greek professional football player, Giorgos Katidis, received a five-match ban for giving a Nazi-style salute last month while celebrating a goal for AEK Athens....

headline.seo: Giorgos Katidis Barred Month After Nazi-Style Salute
headline.main: Player Barred Month After Nazi-Style Salute
headline.print_headline: Player Barred Month After Nazi-Style Salute

docs.snippet: A Grinnell College player scored a record 138 points in a rout over Faith Baptist Bible, and with his accomplishment came thoughts on ethical behavior in such games....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Grinnell College player scored a record 138 points in a rout over Faith Baptist Bible, and with his accomplishment came thoughts on ethical behavior in such games.
docs.abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column examines punishing basketball defeat delivered by Grinnell college to Faith Baptist and moral and theological questions that it raises; many have lauded performance of Grinnell's star player Jack Taylor, who scored NCAA record of 138 points, others have compared extent of defeat to sin of gluttony; both teams have been left to interpret their roles through Biblical lens.

headline.seo: A Basketball Blowout Raises Theological Questions
headline.main: A Basketball Blowout and Its Celebration Raise Theological Questions
headline.print_headline: A Basketball Blowout and Its Celebration Raise Theological Questions

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Faith Baptist Bible College and Theological Seminary (Ankeny, Iowa)
